bad: Upstream: Could not find version on github

about.description:
Conda Docker is an extension to the docker concept by having declarative
environments that are associated with docker images. In addition this tool
does not require docker to build images. Thus allowing for interesting
caching behavior and tricks that docker would not normally allow.
about.summary: Create minimal docker images from conda environments

name: conda-docker
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set name = "conda-docker" %}
{% set version = "0.0.2" %}

package:
  name: {{ name|lower }}
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  url: https://github.com/regro/conda-docker/releases/download/{{ version }}/conda-docker-{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 800eabff3a75b9cdf4f860c6db47b7b442c882b874048acff8e502258332ae83

build:
  noarch: python
  number: 0
  script: {{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . -vv
  entry_points:
    - conda-docker=conda_docker.cli:main

requirements:
  host:
    - python
    - pip
  run:
    - python
    - conda
    - mamba
    - conda-standalone
    - fakechroot

test:
  imports:
    - conda_docker
  commands:
    - conda-docker --help

about:
  home: https://github.com/regro/conda-docker
  license: BSD-3-Clause
  license_family: BSD
  license_file: LICENSE
  summary: Create minimal docker images from conda environments
  description: |
    Conda Docker is an extension to the docker concept by having declarative
    environments that are associated with docker images. In addition this tool
    does not require docker to build images. Thus allowing for interesting
    caching behavior and tricks that docker would not normally allow.
  dev_url: https://github.com/regro/conda-docker

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - scopatz
smithy_version:
No azure token. Create a token and
put it in ~/.conda-smithy/azure.token
3.7.3
